3.name: Narration
3.text:
In a space filled with the scorching heat of
molten lava and the smell of sulfur, a massive
figure sits in repose. Just the movement of that
figure exudes such an overwhelming sense of
intimidation that one would want to flee.

4.name: Narration
4.text:
Terrifyingly sharp fangs, scales dyed in crimson,
and eyes filled with tyranny. This is the
appearance of the tyrant who has lived since
ancient times...!

8.name: Adventurer
8.text:
"And it's not even a joke... the size of this
Ancient... right?"

10.name: Red Dragon
10.text:
"If I thought the noise was bothersome... it was
these rats? The ones who disturbed my sleeping
place."

12.name: Red Dragon
12.text:
"..........? Oh... This unpleasant smell... It's
quite nostalgic, isn't it? The offspring of that
detestable golden dragon, Croustinaus...?"

14.name: Sol
14.text: "Could it be... you... you're... my mother...?!"

15.name: Red Dragon
15.text:
"I have been tormented by that one for quite a
while... but the scream when I bit off its head
was truly magnificent...! It seems like you will
also entertain me!!"

21.name: Adventurer
21.text:
"Damn, the blade won't stand... quite
literally..."

23.name: Adventurer
23.text:
"......ngh, somehow. I'm alive, but I doubt anyone
else is unharmed."

26.name: Red Dragon
26.text:
"Hmph, is this all you've got? Well, for a chick,
you've certainly put up quite a fight, haven't
you?"

27.name: Red Dragon
27.text:
"Well, I was thinking of tormenting you a little
more for my own enjoyment, but I'll show you
mercy. Be grateful as I'll put you out of your
misery with one bite!!"

29.name: Narration
29.text:
As the red dragon opened its massive jaws to bite
and kill Sol, a light resembling lightning painted
the space white in an instant.

31.name: Narration
31.text:
When the flash disappeared and the blinding white
light faded, the figures of the golden dragon and
the small-tempered adventurers had already
vanished. ...It seemed that the intruders had
rescued them, the red dragon realized.

33.name: Narration
33.text:
The red dragon pondered. To think that there were
formidable individuals who could conceal their
presence from a dragon steeped in battle since
ancient times, and even manage to lead away that
many adventurers at once.

34.name: Narration
34.text:
Normally, just the existence of such a
troublemaker would have been enough to enrage and
cause the red dragon to rampage, destroying three
or four human settlements in a fit of anger... but
unusually, the red dragon remained calm.

35.name: Narration
35.text:
He is extremely arrogant and short-tempered, but
he readily acknowledged that the intruders were
formidable opponents. It was precisely this slight
humility that had been his strength, allowing him
to survive until today.

36.name: Narration
36.text:
Well, well. It will take some time to heal from
the battle wounds and molt. At that time, I will
devour that small golden dragon. The power gap
between us is such that I can take and devour that
clever little runt anytime. The pleasure should be
saved for later. With that thought, he coiled up
and began to breathe heavily again.

38.name: Narration
38.text:
The kobolds, who had been pessimistic that half of
their tribe would be burned to death in a fit of
rage, were surprised but couldn't help but feel
grateful for the miracle of the lord not throwing
a tantrum and quietly falling asleep again.
